messages.content: Названия систем связи применяемые в БПЛА камикадзе (барражирующих боеприпасах)

Камикадзе-дроны, также известные как барражирующие боеприпасы, используют различные системы связи, адаптированные для работы в условиях радиоэлектронной борьбы (РЭБ) [cnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [voennoedelo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1). Основное внимание уделяется разработке помехоустойчивых каналов связи и защите от РЭБ [cnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [voennoedelo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1).

**Общие тенденции и системы:**

*   **Помехоустойчивость:** Разработка систем связи, устойчивых к средствам радиоэлектронной борьбы (РЭБ), является ключевой задачей [cnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [voennoedelo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1).
*   **Защищенные каналы:** Камикадзе-дроны часто используют защищенные каналы связи [cnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [voennoedelo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1). Для защиты каналов связи часто используется криптографическая защита радиоканала между землей и БПЛА с помощью "ad [cyberleninka](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0)d-on" защиты, где шифратор помещается между бортовым/наземным оборудованием и трансивером.
*   **Защита от РЭБ:** Дроны оснащены системами противодействия радиоэлектронной борьбе [cnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [voennoedelo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1).
*   **Интеграция ИИ:** В некоторых дронах используется бортовой искусственный интеллект (ИИ) для идентификации и приоритизации целей [cnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0).
*   **Управление по оптоволокну:** Растет тенденция использования оптоволоконных кабелей для управления дронами, что делает их необнаружимыми и невосприимчивыми к РЭБ [cnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [voennoedelo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1).

**Конкретные системы и технологии:**

*   **ZALA Aero "Lancet" ("Изделие 51/52/53"):** Эти дроны используют помехоустойчивые каналы связи и оснащены средствами противодействия радиоэлектронной борьбе.
*   **FPV-дроны "Технодрон":** Эта компания разрабатывает FPV-дроны с оптоволоконным управлением для увеличения дальности, преодолевая ограничения существующих систем примерно в 20 км [cnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). Они также работают над дронами-перехватчиками с оптоволоконной связью [www1](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6).
*   **"Цербер":** Система управления роями оптоволоконных дронов-камикадзе [www1](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6). Он использует ИИ, чтобы позволить дронам работать как единое целое, при этом одни выполняют разведку, а другие атакуют. Дроны могут использовать мобильные базовые станции для навигации в дополнение к спутникам [www1](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7).
*   **"Микроб":** Этот FPV-дрон использует модуль машинного зрения и автопилот для самостоятельного наведения, что делает его устойчивым к РЭБ [www1](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7). Он также использует нестандартные каналы для приема сигнала и передачи видео.
*   **Турецкий FPV-дрон MERKÜT:** Этот дрон-камикадзе использует внешнюю систему связи для обеспечения безопасности оператора [www1](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-8).

**Радиоэлектронная борьба и контрмеры:**

*   **Системы РЭБ:** Такие системы, как "Солярис-Н", предназначены для подавления каналов радиоуправления дронами и сигналов GPS в радиусе 5 км [aa](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-9). Комплекс РЭБ "Свет-КУ" может идентифицировать и подавлять каналы управления дронами [www1](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-10).
*   **Защита от помех:** Иранские дроны Shahed-149 оснащаются системами защиты от помех [www1](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-11).
*   **Преимущество оптоволокна:** Дроны, управляемые по оптоволоконному кабелю, не обнаруживаются РЭБ [tasnimnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-12).

**Шифрование:**

Для защиты каналов связи часто используется шифрование радиоканала между землей и БПЛА [cyberleninka](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0). Распространенные алгоритмы шифрования включают:

*   **Криптография на эллиптических кривых (ECC):** Часто используется в связи БПЛА из-за высокой безопасности при короткой длине ключа [preprints](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0).
*   **Advanced Encryption Standard (AES):** Обеспечивает надежную безопасность, но может создавать значительную вычислительную нагрузку [arxiv](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1).
*   **Легкие алгоритмы шифрования:** Разработаны для устройств с ограниченной вычислительной мощностью и памятью [arxiv](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1). Примером является семейство ASCON [researchgate](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-2).

**Антенны CRPA:**

Для противодействия украинской радиоэлектронной борьбе российские разработчики используют более совершенные антенны с управляемой диаграммой направленности приема (CRPA) с числом элементов до 16 [cyberleninka](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0). CRPA используют несколько антенных элементов в сочетании с цифровой обработкой сигналов для динамической регулировки диаграммы усиления и подавления помех [defenseadvancement](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1).

**Оптоволоконное управление:**

Значительным событием является использование оптоволоконных кабелей для управления дронами, что делает их неуязвимыми для радиоэлектронной борьбы [militarnyi](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4).

В целом, системы связи, используемые в дронах-камикадзе, постоянно развиваются, чтобы противостоять угрозам РЭБ и обеспечить надежную связь в сложных условиях.

Okay, I will conduct Google Searches to gather the most recent information on "защищенные каналы связи БПЛА камикадзе" (protected communication channels for kamikaze UAVs) and synthesize it into a verifiable text artifact.
Based on the search results, here's a summary of information regarding protected communication channels for kamikaze UAVs, focusing on the most recent developments:

**General Security Measures:**

*   **Encryption:** A common method to protect communication channels involves cryptographic protection of the radio channel between the ground and the UAV. This can be achieved through "ad [cyberleninka](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0)d-on" protection where an encryptor is placed between the onboard/ground equipment and the transceiver, ensuring that cryptographically secured data is always transmitted over the radio channel. Stream ciphers with pseudo-rando [cyberleninka](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0)m sequence generators are used.
*   **Frequency Hopping:**  Sign [cyberleninka](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0)al interference technology for UAV countermeasures includes radio frequency interference targeting communication frequency bands like 2.4 GHz and 5.8 GHz.
*   **Radio Electronic Warfare ( [spiedigitallibrary](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1)EW):** Radio-electronic warfare (EW) involves technical measures to protect objects from unauthorized drone penetration. Modern EW systems can detect and [rub-in](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2) neutralize drones by creating interference for communication and navigation channels.
*   **Jamming and Spoofing Count [rub-in](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2)ermeasures:** Modern counter-UAS solutions include drone signal jamming and GPS spoofing.
*   **Redundancy and Alternative [nqdefense](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3) Control:** Some drones use terrain matching, image recognition, and inertial navigation for independent positioning, but these are not common in the civilian industry.

**Specific Technologies and Tec [nqdefense](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3)hniques:**

*   **"Add-on" Encryption Devices:** These devices can be integrated between the UAV's control system and the transceiver to encrypt data transmitted over the radio channel.
*   **CRPA Antennas:** To counte [cyberleninka](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0)r Ukrainian electronic warfare, Russian developers are using more advanced Controlled Reception Pattern Antennas (CRPA) with up to 16 elements.
*   **Fiber Optic Control:** A s [militarnyi](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4)ignificant development is the use of fiber-optic cables for drone control, making them invulnerable to radio-electronic warfare. These drones transmit high-resol [csis](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5) [aa](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-6) [krymr](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7)ution video and are not affected by terrain irregularities.
*   **Mobile Communication Modul [aa](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-6)es:** Russia has started equipping Shahed-136 drones with mobile communication modules that connect to Ukrainian networks to transmit telemetry data.

**Countermeasures Against UAVs: [militarnyi](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4)**

*   **Radio Frequency (RF) Analyzers:** RF sensors receive and analyze radio signals to detect, identify, and track drone operations.
*   **Signal Interference:** Thi [dedrone](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-8)s involves creating interference or intercepting control of the UAV by jamming its radio signals and communication channels with the operator.
*   **Physical Capture:** Physic [alasartech-security](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-9) [scilead](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-10)al capture mechanisms or high-energy lasers can be used to seize or destroy UAVs.
*   **Drone Interceptors:** Usin [alasartech-security](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-9) [spiedigitallibrary](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1)g drone interceptors or kamikaze drones is another method, but it may not be suitable for protecting against medium or large UAVs or drone swarms.
*   **Electronic Warfare Systems [arsenal-otechestva](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-11) [secuteck](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-12) [obrazovanie33](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-13):** Systems like the Krasukha-4 can be used to deceive enemy drones and potentially take control of them through electronic means.
*   **Anti-Drone Nets:** Special [cnas](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-14)ized FPV drones like "Osed" have been developed to intercept enemy UAVs by shooting a net, causing them to lose control.

**Russia-Ukraine War Context:** [ura](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-15)

*   **FPV Drones:** There is increasing importance of light quadcopters on the battlefield, necessitating effective defense methods.
*   **Trench-Level Warfare:** Ta [cyberleninka](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-16)ctical electronic warfare is heavily emphasized, with Russians calling it trench-level warfare.
*   **Drone Fratricide:** Lack o [csis](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5)f communication between units leads to friendly fire incidents involving UAVs.
*   **Evolving Russian Tactics:* [csis](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5)* Russia is improving tactics and using decoys to enhance the operational capabilities of its OWA-UAV systems. This includes integrating jammin [iiss](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-17)g-resistant antennas and using Ukrainian mobile networks for data links.
*   **Domestic Production:** Rus [iiss](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-17)sia is now assembling and producing Shahed-136 drones domestically.
*   **Fiber Optic Drones:** Both [militarnyi](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4) Russia and Ukraine are actively using and developing FPV drones controlled via fiber optic cables.

**Cybersecurity Standards:**

* [csis](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5) [aa](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-6)   **Cybersecurity for UAVs:**  "GLONASS" is developing cybersecurity standards for drones to protect them from cyberattacks. This is considered crucial for l [cnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-18)ifting flight restrictions and enabling the safe industrial use of UAVs.
 [cnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-18)
While specific details on encryption algorithms and key management protocols used in "add-on" encryption devices for UAV communication, especially in kamikaze drones, are limited in the search results, some general information and trends can be gathered.

**Encryption Algorithms and Protocols:**

*   **Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC):** ECC is frequently used in UAV communication due to its strong security with shorter key lengths, making it suitable for resource-constrained drones [preprints](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0). The mathematical properties of elliptic curves enhance the algorithm's resilience to cryptographic attacks [preprints](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0). ECC is effective for key generation, exchange, and digital signatures, providing a secure solution for safeguarding confidential data in drone networks [preprints](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0).
*   **Advanced Encryption Standard (AES):** While AES offers robust security, it may impose significant computational overhead on resource-constrained UAV platforms [arxiv](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1).
*   **Lightweight Cryptography:** Lightweight encryption algorithms are designed for devices with limited processing power and memory, making them suitable for UAVs [arxiv](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1). They prioritize efficiency while providing strong cryptographic protection [arxiv](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1). Examples include the ASCON family, which is known for its simple yet resilient design [researchgate](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-2). ASCON-128a is presented as an optimal choice for UAV communication systems requiring a balance between efficiency and security [researchgate](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-2) [arxiv](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1). ChaCha is also optimized for mobile devices and has a higher CPU efficiency [preprints](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0).
*   **Hash Algorithms:** SHA-3 and SHA-2 are commonly employed hash functions for randomization in cryptography [preprints](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0). SHA-3 is more secure but its slower software implementation prevents it from being widely utilized [preprints](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0).
*   **Digital Signature Algorithm (DSA):** DSA is used to generate digital signatures, often in conjunction with the SHA-2 family of hash functions [preprints](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0).
*   **One-Time Pad (OTP):** Symmetric security mechanisms, such as OTP, are frequently employed to safeguard transmissions [rdd](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-3).
*   **HIGHT:** HIGHT lightweight encryption algorithm can be used to cipher payload data to increase security MAVLink communication protocol [turcomat](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-4).

**Key Management Protocols:**

*   **Diffie-Hellman (DH) key exchange:** DH key exchange algorithm can be combined with Hash-based Message Authentication Code (HMAC) within ROS communication channels to authenticate exchanged UAV data [arxiv](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-5).
*   **Public Key Infrastructure (PKI):** PKI, along with Elliptic Curve Cryptography, can be used for inter-drone communication authentication, though it can be resource-intensive [preprints](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0).
*   **Physical Unclonable Functions (PUFs):** PUFs can be integrated with low-complexity cryptographic primitives for secure mutual authentication, without storing secret information on the UAV [mdpi](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-6). PUFs can also be merged with quantum-resistant key-exchange methods to future-proof UAV networks [mdpi](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-6).
*   **Chinese Remainder Theorem (CRT) and Hash Function:** These are used to construct a swarm key by combining the local key and the session key to reduce the overhead of individual UAV nodes in the swarm [mdpi](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-7).
*   **Swarm Broadcast Protocol (SBP):** SBP contains a security key management scheme that manages a broadcast key among the swarm for a leader to broadcast encrypted messages to followers [hongpeng-guo](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-8).

**Strengths and Weaknesses Against Modern Cryptanalysis Techniques:**

*   **ECC:** Offers a high level of security and resilience to various cryptographic attacks due to the mathematical properties of elliptic curves [preprints](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0).
*   **Lightweight Algorithms:** Designed to be efficient on resource-constrained devices, but their security needs to be carefully evaluated against modern cryptanalysis techniques [arxiv](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1). Comparative analysis assesses performance metrics such as encryption and decryption speeds, resource utilization, and resistance to cryptographic vulnerabilities against established algorithms like AES [researchgate](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-2).
*   **Vulnerabilities:** UAVs are susceptible to various security attacks such as data modification, denial of service, snooping, man-in-the-middle, and WiFi attacks [scispace](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-9). Communication links are vulnerable to jamming, GPS spoofing, and cyber warfare [law-in-action](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-10).
*   **Countermeasures:** Common protective measures include encrypting command, control, and data links, deploying Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS), implementing strict authentication systems, and enhancing data integrity and traceability through quantum cryptography and blockchain technology [xmake](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-11).

**Specific to Kamikaze Drones:**

*   **Data Link Security:** Kamikaze drones rely on encrypted data links for human control, which creates vulnerabilities if these links are attacked physically, jammed electronically, or subverted through cyber warfare [law-in-action](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-10).
*   **Autonomy:** The vulnerability of communication links to interference is an argument for greater autonomy in kamikaze drones [law-in-action](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-10).
*   **Spoofing:** Neural networks used in machine learning for autonomous weapons are intrinsically vulnerable to spoofing [law-in-action](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-10).

**Additional Considerations:**

*   **Military Drone Requirements:** Military drones require stringent communication and data link protection due to risks like information theft, malicious tampering, false commands, and GPS position spoofing [xmake](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-11).

Controlled Reception Pattern Antennas (CRPAs) are becoming increasingly common, particularly in the defense sector, as effective solutions against jamming and spoofing [safran-navigation-timing](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0). They are a specialized form of GNSS antenna designed to mitigate interference from electronic jamming by using multiple antenna elements combined with digital signal processing to dynamically adjust the gain pattern and null out the interference [defenseadvancement](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1). Unlike Fixed Reception Pattern Antennas (FRPAs), CRPAs can modify their reception pattern in real-time, effectively reducing the impact of jamming signals [defenseadvancement](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1).

**Key Characteristics of CRPAs:**

*   **Multiple Antenna Elements:** CRPAs consist of several separate antenna elements arranged in a specific pattern [spirent](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2). The number of elements affects the number of simultaneous attacks that can be neutralized [unmannedsystemstechnology](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-3).
*   **Adaptive Signal Processing:** CRPAs employ sophisticated signal processing techniques, including beamforming, null steering, and spatial filtering [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-4).
    *   **Beamforming:** Combines signals from multiple elements to create a directional reception pattern that enhances the gain toward legitimate GPS satellites [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-4).
    *   **Null Steering:** Identifies the direction of interfering signals and creates "nulls" in the reception pattern to minimize their impact [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-4).
    *   **Spatial Filtering:** Exploits the spatial separation between desired and undesired signals to differentiate between legitimate satellite signals and malicious transmissions [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-4).
*   **Dynamic Reception Pattern:** CRPAs can dynamically adjust their reception pattern in real-time to ensure gain in the direction of genuine GNSS satellite signals and nulls in the direction of unwanted signals [unmannedsystemstechnology](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-3). The antenna's reception pattern is highly adaptable and can be changed rapidly to protect against attacks from varying directions [unmannedsystemstechnology](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-3).
*   **Anti-Jamming and Anti-Spoofing:** CRPAs are designed to resist radio jamming and spoofing [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-4). They minimize jamming signals using null generation or null steering and maximize "truth" signals using beamforming or beam steering [safran-navigation-timing](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0).
*   **Versatility:** CRPAs can be used in various applications, from military and defense to commercial and consumer use [unmannedsystemstechnology](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-5). They are also compatible with different GPS/GNSS bands [unmannedsystemstechnology](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-5).

**Effectiveness Against Ukrainian Electronic Warfare Tactics:**

*   **Mitigation of Jamming and Spoofing:** CRPAs are highly efficient in countering jamming and spoofing by dynamically adjusting to mitigate such disruptive signals [asianssr](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-6).
*   **Resilience to Signal Interference:** CRPAs enhance the resilience of GNSS signals by providing anti-jamming capabilities, ensuring uninterrupted and accurate data even in challenging environments where signal interference is prevalent [defenseadvancement](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1).
*   **Protection Against Multiple Types of RF Interference:** CRPAs are designed to protect GNSS receivers against multiple types of RF interference, including intentional GNSS frequency jamming and spoofing attacks [spirent](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-7).
*   **Enhanced Navigation and Timing:** CRPAs allow military ground vehicles to maintain accurate navigation and timing information in GPS-denied environments, ensuring that vehicles can continue to operate effectively during electronic warfare engagements [defenseadvancement](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1).
*   **Improved Accuracy and Reliability:** With their advanced design and signal processing techniques, CRPAs offer improved accuracy and reliability in a variety of applications [unmannedsystemstechnology](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-5).

**Developments and Upgrades:**

*   **Increased Number of Antenna Elements:** Russia has been increasing the number of antenna elements in its CRPAs, from 4 to 8 to 12 and beyond, to improve their ability to overcome jammers [forbes](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-8). **Limitations:**

They also consume more power than FRPAs [spirent](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-7).
